file_content.text: Good luck. I trust you will do well.
Ah, it's good to see you through my own eyes once more. What did the Council have to say?
Other Masters have fallen ill--the Council has asked me to save them.
I have to help other Jedi.
I see. But there is still someone we must find: the person behind this, whoever was in my mind.
Are you sure you don't remember anything specific about your tormentor?
I need any clues you can give.
I have tried, but everything is hazy.
Stop him, so that I don't have to be shielded anymore. So your strength can be restored.
Your illness wasn't an isolated case. It seems I'm the only one who can help.
Nothing good.
Be careful to conserve your strength. I would hate to lose you.
Trust, Yuon. Will be well.
Remember. Let your instincts guide you. Keep to the Jedi Code. And may the Force be with you.
I just need time to rest. Speak to the Council.
Padawan--no. No, I was making you a Jedi. What happened?
I feel... so much better. But why do you look so weak? What did you do?
I shielded you from the person who was making you ill, but it took some of my strength.
I did what was necessary.
Don't worry about me, Yuon. I'm just glad you're okay.
Everything's alright, Master.
Thank you, and... I'm sorry.
You were raving during your illness. Any detail could help us.
Do you remember anything?
The last thing I remember clearly is... your ceremony on Tython. Oh, my student, I am sorry I wasn't a better Master.
I wouldn't be the Jedi I am if it weren't for you.
You were a fine Master.
That honors me more than you know.
What matters is that whoever was hurting you can't do so any longer.
Focus on getting well.
I wish you had told me about your condition sooner.
You hid your illness from me.
Yes. I see now the foolishness of hiding it. Now I am... more myself.
You are Yuon Par. Is no other you can be.
I could feel someone else in my mind. Polluting my thoughts... twisting them.
You won't be fully cured until he is defeated.
The plaguemaster.
Don't think about that, Master. It's over.
You're safe now.
Can you remember any specifics about this person?
Describe him.
I really wish I could give you more details, but my memory of that time is... hazy at best.
Pardon me. The Council wishes to speak with you when you're ready.
I will speak with them immediately.
Of course.
Thank you again for helping Yuon. And... teaching me a few things as well.
Do you know what they want?
Any idea why?
They only said it was important.
I want to finish speaking with Yuon first.
I'm not done here.
I'll be alright for now. Go to the Council--we can speak later.
Where's my student? Where....
Uhh....
Please. Help me.
All over. It's all over....
I'm not mad. The man in the shadows is making me this way. He brings the darkness--it's coming!
The man in the shadows? I don't understand.
Who's making you this way?
I can't help you if you don't calm down.
Take it slowly.
You've completely lost it, haven't you?
You're insane.
Parkanas! Parkanas, where are you?
Yuon! Pharen, please see Yuon back to her room.
I'm sorry you had to see that. I'm Attros Finn, the researcher here; we must get to work finding a cure.
She keeps talking about someone called "Parkanas." Who is that?
Who is "Parkanas"?
You don't know either? Nevermind. A cure is what Yuon really needs.
I stand ready to help.
I agree.
Is Yuon going to be okay?
I'm worried about my Master.
I wish I could tell you, but Yuon's illness is... it's unlike anything I've ever seen.
The problem is that the greatest collection of learning in the galaxy--the Jedi Temple here on Coruscant--has lain in ruins since the war.
I believe the answer to curing Yuon is in the archives of the temple ruins. But accessing them won't be easy.
If it will help Yuon, I'll get us the information.
I'll do what I can.
How can you be sure the answer is in the Jedi Temple? Perhaps there's someplace else you could look.
You "believe" it's there?
If it was known to the Jedi at any point, it's in the temple.
Centuries of learning scattered. We added to the Sith's victory by being careless.
We didn't track our knowledge?
The temple's artificers created a system to sort through the vast stores of knowledge--a set of three holocrons that served as guides.
The wisdom and personalities of the order's greatest Masters were imprinted on these guides, which they called Noetikons.
Let's find them, then.
Unfortunately, we... don't have the Noetikons, not anymore.
These Noetikons formed a sort of virtual Jedi Council?
I've seen similar systems.
That's exactly it--and I need your help to recover them.
I'm good at research, perhaps I can manage without these Noetikons.
Are you sure we need them?
We're talking about hundreds of libraries' worth of information. We'd both die of old age first.
The temple ruins were looted; the Noetikons were taken. I have a lead on one of them--but, it's not in friendly hands.
Is no matter. To help Yuon, we face anyone.
Republic security spotted some Gand scavengers carrying a Noetikon, in the Migrant Merchants' Guild. The Republic brought one of the Gand in for questioning, but he won't talk.
Being taken in by security must be quite intimidating. Maybe he'll speak to a Jedi.
I could be a friendly face.
I haven't encountered any Gand before.
What's a "Gand"?
They're a fascinating species; quiet, humble, very loyal to one another.
If this Gand has information to help Yuon, I'll get some answers.
He will talk to me.
The Republic officer you want is Alec Efran. He's at the security outpost with the Gand right now.
And I'm working on a lead for the second Noetikon. I should have something by the time you get back. Good luck!
I failed, I failed, I failed. I'm sorry I failed.
Once there were two little boys. Their names were Parkanas and... and... something. Why can't I remember?
It's going to be alright. I'm sure you'll remember eventually. Just relax.
Calm down, Master.
But I have to rememb--Padawan!
Yuon?
The story, the other little boy in the--Padawan!
I thought this Attros Finn was meant to be helping you.
You should be being treated.
Attros, Attros, no--Padawan!
Have never seen Yuon so, Herald. Not in all years of knowing.
